questions.question:
Let X be a square matrix. Consider the following two statements on X.

I. X is invertible
II. Determinant of X is non-zero

Which one of the following is TRUE?

(GATE CSE 2019)
options:
A.

I implies II; II does not imply I

B.

II implies I; I does not imply II

C.

I does not imply II; II does not imply I
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:

(ISRO CSE 2018)
options:
B.

\(2 n \pi \lt x \lt (2 n+1) \pi\), for n in N

questions.question:
Consider a matrix P whose only eigenvectors are the multiples of \(\begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 4 \end{bmatrix}\).
Consider the following statements.
(I) P does not have an inverse
(II) P has a repeated eigenvalue
(III) P cannot be diagonalized
Which one of the following options is correct?

(GATE CSE 2018)
options:
A.

Only I and III are necessarily true

C.

Only I and II are necessarily true

D.

Only II and III are necessarily true
questions.correct_answer:
D.

Only II and III are necessarily true
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Let A be nxn real valued square symmetric matrix of rank 2 with \(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{n}A^{2}_{ij}=50\). Consider the following statements.

(I) One eigen value must be in [-5, 5]
(II) The eigen value with the largest magnitude must be strictly greater than 5.

Which of the above statements about eigen values of A is/are necessarily CORRECT?

(GATE CSE 2017 SET-1)
